column1: U.S. President Donald Trump wants a "level playing field" when it comes to taxes and Amazon.com, his economic advisor says. Trump has been harshly critical of the company in recent days. Amazon voluntarily collects state sales tax on items it sells direct to customers in all 45 states that impose one. The retailer is not required to collect taxes on third-party sellers using its Marketplace service.
column2: QIAGEN N.V. announces that it will initiate the repurchase of a first tranche of shares. The maximum purchase price per share will not exceed the average closing price for the last five trading days prior to the day of purchase. The purpose of the share repurchase is to hold the shares in treasury in order to satisfy obligations from exchangeable debt instruments and/or employee share-based remuneration plans.
column3: DTE Energy will announce its first quarter 2018 earnings before the market opens Wednesday, . The company will conduct a conference call to discuss earnings results at 9 a.m. ET the same day. The telephone dial-in numbers are U.S. and Canada toll free: (888) 505-4377 or international toll: (719) 325-2390.
column4: Momenta Pharmaceuticals, Inc. will release its financial results for the first quarter ended and provide a corporate update before the U.S. financial markets open on Tuesday, . Management will host a conference call on that date at 8:00 a.m. ET to discuss these results and provide an update on the company. To access the call, please dial (877) 224-9084 (domestic) or (720) 5
column5: SpaceX successfully launched a secret U.S. government payload called Zuma. The mission marked Elon Musk's company's first in 2018. Last year, SpaceX carried out 18 successful launches, the highest in any calendar year. The firm is now looking towards its next challenge, launching the Falcon Heavy, its largest rocket to date. It will carry an original Tesla Roadster playing David Bowie's "Space Oddity" into a billion year elliptic Mars orbit.
column6: Instagram is adding a payment feature to its app. Users can now store payment information and buy products directly inside the app. The feature is currently available only for a select group of partners, including online restaurant reservation site Resy. It's part of an update announced last year to allow for appointment booking in the app, which was previously only available on Facebook-owned Instagram. The company has been building out its ad model to allow businesses and brands to advertise seamlessly in a user's content
column7: The company reported a loss of 122,000 video subscribers for the first quarter. Charter also added 331,000 internet subscribers, less than a forecast of 370,000 additions. Comcast 's stock fell 4.6 percent, while shares of Altice USA dropped 9.3 percent.Cable companies have been under pressure in recent years as consumers shift away from traditional cable services to over-the-top options like Netflix and Hulu.
column8: Holly Energy Partners, L.P. plans to announce results for its quarter ended on , before the opening of trading on the NYSE. The Partnership has scheduled a webcast conference to discuss financial results. The webcast may be accessed at:
column9: Ye Jianming was taken in for questioning this year, a source said. He has been investigated for suspected economic crimes. CEFC China Energy agreed in September to buy a 14.16 percent stake in Rosneft for $9.1 billion. shares in the firm's listed subsidiary CEFC Anhui International Holding slumped as much as 10 percent, the maximum allowed, to their lowest since Sept. 2014.
column10: Washington, D.C., has the highest share of federal jobs and the highest percentage of residents who depend on federal contracts. States with high percentages of children who receive health insurance through CHIP also ranked highly on the list of the states most impacted by the shutdown. The average score for a state that voted majority republican during the 2016 presidential election was 28.17, and theAverage score for state that vote majority democrat was 22.90.
column11: Saudi Aramco IPO was expected to come to market sometime this year, potentially the largest ever. advisors are struggling to arrive at the $2 trillion valuation sought by Saudi's crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman. The battle between where Aramco's stock would list is seen as a horse race between the New York Stock Exchange and the London Stock Exchange. If so, it would represent a setback for the world's largest oil producer's efforts to reform its economy.
column12: Marc Benioff said tech leaders need to modify their autocratic style. He cited the example of Uber as a company that he claimed, under previous CEO Travis Kalanick, had forgotten to value trust among its customers. "What is the most important to you. Is it trust or is it growth? Because if anything trumps trust, then you are in trouble," he said. Dara Khosrowshahi who is the current CEO of Uber was also on the panel
column13: Sabra Health Care REIT, Inc. will issue its 2018 first quarter earnings release on . A conference call with a simultaneous webcast will be held on Thursday, May 10 at 10:00 a.m. Pacific Time. The dial-in number for U.S. participants is 844-862-3710. The conference ID number is 6176379. A digital replay of the call will be available on our website at
column14: Additive Orthopaedics, LLC. has received FDA 510(k) clearance for its Patient Specific 3D Printed Bone Segments. The Company has seen over 1000 devices implanted since their commercial launch in early 2017. The company has recently closed a Series B Round of $1M and is focused on the integration of advanced manufacturing and biologics for the benefit of a better patient outcome.
column15: Okta Inc. (OKTA) on Wednesday reported a loss of $24.7 million in its fiscal fourth quarter. Losses, adjusted for stock option expense, were 10 cents per share. Cloud identity management company posted revenue of $77.8 million in the period. Okta expects full-year results to range from loss of 67 cents to loss of 62 cents per cent.
column16: "It's extremely hard to find acquisitions that would be accretive to Apple (in) the $50-$100 billion range" "I do see a business that they know everything about ... I'm delighted to see them repurchasing shares" "No one except the Wall Street Journal, the New York Times and (now) the Washington Post has come up with a digital product"
column17: Chinese-led North America Casin Holdings was previously trying to acquire CHX Holdings, the parent company of the Chicago Stock Exchange. The deal collapsed in February after it was rejected by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) The NYSE has discussed paying around $70 million for CHX which would be triple the price offered by North AmericaCasin Holdings. CHX declined to comment on the story when contacted by CNBC.
column18: Right-wing commentator Laura Ingraham has taken a week off as host of her Fox News television show. Liberty Mutual, which confirmed to CNBC that it doesn't plans to run anymore ads on her show, and Bayer, which made its announcement on social media. The advertising exodus began Thursday, shortly after Ingraham sent a tweet mocking a survivor of February's mass shooting at a Parkland, Florida, high school.
column19: USDA issued a broad set of principles it would like to see in the farm bill. The agency said some of its other priorities for the bill include encouraging younger farmers. The current farm bill, which was projected to cost $489 billion over its five-year life, is set to expire this year.. The U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said in a statement that the principles will be used as a road map.
column20: The Klein Law Firm announces that a class action complaint has been filed on behalf of shareholders of Macquarie Infrastructure Corporation. The action, which was filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, alleges that the Company violated federal securities laws.Shareholders have until to petition the court for lead plaintiff status. Your ability to share in any recovery does not require that you serve as lead plaintiff.
column21: China is recognizing mobile infrastructure is a critical piece of national infrastructure, says Ericsson's CEO. Borje Ekholm urges other countries to realize the potential of mobile infrastructure investments. Ericsson announced Monday that it had signed a memorandum of understanding with China Mobile. The new pact sees Ericsson join forces with the world's biggest network operator, as they plan to cover the internet of things testing and field trials.
column22: Selective Insurance Group, Inc. will release its fourth quarter 2017 financial results after the market closes on Thursday, . The company will hold a conference call on Friday, at 8:30 a.m. (ET) to discuss the results. This call will be webcast live and can be accessed on Selective's website at
column23: El Pollo Loco Holdings Inc. (LOCO) reported a fourth-quarter loss of $38,000. On a per-share basis, the Costa Mesa, California-based company said it had a loss of less than 1 cent. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 11 cents per share. For the year, the company reported profit of $8.6 million.
column24: Leon Cooperman is the chairman and CEO of Omega Advisors. He says United Continental can increase its profit margins toward the industry average. "I would expect the stock to probably in the next 2 to 3 years be a double," he says. His firm agreed last year to a $4.9 million settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission after allegations of insider trading. The firm has approximately $3.8 billion in assets under management.
column25: Pure Industrial Real Estate Trust (the "Trust") (TSX: AAR.UN) today announced that its Board of Trustees has approved a cash distribution of $0.026 per trust unit for the month of March 2018. This distribution will be paid on to unitholders of record at the close of business on . The Trust is an internally managed REIT and is one of the largest publicly-traded REITs in
column26: Penumbra, Inc. will host a conference call to discuss financial results for the fourth quarter and year ended after market close on Tuesday, at 5:00 PM Eastern Time. The conference call can be accessed live over the phone by dialing (866) 393-4306 for domestic callers or (734) 385-2616 for international callers (conference id: 6884769) or the webcast can be
column27: Shares of chipmaker Broadcom jumped 4.41 percent in after-hours trade. The company said on Thursday it would buy back up to $12 billion of its common stock. The authorization of the repurchase program is effective immediately and until the end of Broadcom's 2019 fiscal year on Nov. 3. Broadcom last month ended its efforts to acquire rival Qualcomm, which it was trying to buy.
column28: Cumberland Farms, Inc. will post its financial results for the second quarter of fiscal 2018, ended , on a password-protected website on . Holders of the notes, prospective investors, broker-dealers and securities analysts may obtain access to the website by emailing InvestorRelations@cumberlandfarms.com .About Cumberland Farms: What started in 1939 with a cow and a dream has grown into a network of nearly 600
column29: Yelp Inc. (YELP) on Thursday reported a loss of $2.3 million in its first quarter. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The online business reviews company posted revenue of $223.1 million in the period. For the current quarter ending in July, Yelp said it expects revenue in the range of $230 million to $233 million. The company expects full-year revenue to be $943 million to$967 million.
column30: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against Infinity Property and Casualty Corporation (NASDAQ: IPCC) and its board of directors for breach of fiduciary duty. Stockholders will receive $51.60 in cash and 1.2019 shares of Kemper Corporation common stock for each share of IPCC that they hold. The transaction is valued at approximately $1.3 billion and is expected to close in the third quarter of 2018.
column31: The flu was still widespread in 48 states and causing high levels of illness in 43 states in the week that ended Feb. 3. The CDC estimates that up to 56,000 people, mostly older adults, die from complications. Nearly 150 children died in the last severe flu season in 2014-2015. This flu season is now more than 11 weeks old, and the average flu season lasts 16 weeks.
column32: Bitcoin has been on a jolting ride this year after soaring more than 1,200 percent in 2017. It rose 30.9 percent Thursday, to top $12,000 after plunging more than 30 percent earlier in the week. Eliot Spitzer, former New York governor and attorney general, said he doesn't own a single bitcoin. "I don't get it," he said.
column33: Hawthorn Bancshares of Jefferson City, MO (NASDAQ:HWBK) announced today that its Board of Directors approved a quarterly cash dividend of $0.07 per share payable to shareholders of record at the close of business on . This dividend payment is consistent with the previous quarterly rate. It is important to note that actual results could differ from those projected in such forward-looking statements.
column34: DexCom Inc. (DXCM) on Tuesday reported a loss of $9.4 million in its fourth quarter. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The medical device company posted revenue of $221 million in the period.DexCom expects full-year revenue in the range of $830 million to $850 million. The company's shares have fallen 3 percent since the beginning of the year.
column35: Chinese conglomerate HNA Group has cut its stake in Deutsche Bank to around 8.8 percent. The aviation-to-financial services conglomerate is suffering financial strain following a $50 billion acquisition spree over the past two years. HNA had initially held 9.9 percent of Deutsche Bank but that filings showed last week its share of voting rights had fallen to 9.2 percent. A message to an HNA spokesman seeking comment was not immediately answered.
column36: Mergenet Solutions, Inc., an award winning Medical Technology Business Incubator, located in Deerfield Beach, Fl., has announced it will extend its shareholder dividend claim deadline. The deadline has been extended through . Forms may be obtained from the company or company's stock transfer agent. Learn more at For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or see
column37: Extra Space Storage Inc. declares a quarterly dividend of $0.86 per share on the common stock of the Company for the second quarter 2018. This is a 10.3% increase over the previous quarterly dividend. The dividend is payable on to stockholders of record at the close of business on . As of , the Company owned and/or operated 1,523 self-storage properties.
column38: Saul Centers, Inc. has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.52 per share on its common stock. The common dividend is consistent with the amount paid in the previous quarter. The Company also declared quarterly dividend on its 6.875% Series C Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Stock. The preferred dividends will be paid to holders of record on .
column39: China will quicken the pace of reform and implement its pledge to opening up banks, securities and insurance. China will also step up protection of intellectual property rights and backs a free trade zone in its southern province of Hainan. The comments reinforce President Xi Jinping's pledge this month to open up the economy to foreign investors and competition, amid growing trade friction with the United States, with the two countries threatening tariffs on $100 billion of goods.
column40: Sue Hayden has joined Gulf Oil as executive vice president & chief marketing officer. She will report to president and chief executive officer, Eric Johnson. Hayden brings over 35 years of industry and leadership experience to the role. Prior to joining Gulf, Hayden served as vice president of fuel sales North America at BP where she oversaw the branded, unbranded and commercial business for the company's North American segment.
column41: The dollar index gained more than 1.3 percent in the previous week. The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note crossed the 3 percent level. The Federal Open Market Committee's May policy meeting and the release of nonfarm payrolls later this week will likely be in focus. The loss of momentum in the world economy is supportive of the dollar because it is a 'counter-cyclical currency,'" said Joseph Capurso.
column42: FCC documents show Apple designed a gold iPhone X but hasn't released it yet. Apple only released silver and space grey versions when the $999 device hit the market at the end of last year. The document was created in July, suggesting the images may have been taken quite far ahead of the iPhone X launch. Apple's high-end device has had a number of manufacturing issues and even cut its production target for the first quarter of the year.
column43: Leon Cooperman is the chairman and CEO of the Omega Advisors hedge fund. He said the best way to judge President Donald Trump is to compare him to Ronald Reagan. "I kind of contrast Donald Trump with Ronald Reagan," he said. "Ditto for President Trump," the hedge fund chief said in an interview with CNBC. "When Ronald Reagan ran for president, he said, 'I'm going to get the government off the backs of the people'"
column44: Douglas Emmett Inc. (DEI) on Tuesday reported a key measure of profitability in its first quarter. The results met Wall Street expectations. The real estate investment trust posted revenue of $212.2 million in the period. The company's shares have dropped 6 percent since the beginning of the year.. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $38.52.
column45: "I don't pay any attention to what economists say, frankly," Buffett said two years ago. The Oracle of Omaha cited the example of famed-economist John Maynard Keynes. Keynes faltered using top-down economic forecasts such as credit cycle predictions. But when the economist as investor switched to a value philosophy focused on owning stocks of a few well-run companies, his investment performance improved.
column46: Ashford Hospitality Prime, Inc. completed the acquisition of the 266-room Ritz-Carlton Sarasota in Sarasota, Florida for $171 million ($643,000 per key) The Company also closed on the acquisition. of a 22-acre plot of vacant land for $9.7 million that is currently entitled for residential development. Concurrent with the completion of the acquisition, the Company has financed the hotel with a $100 million non-recourse mortgage loan.
column47: ZIM Integrated Shipping Services Ltd. announces financial results for the first quarter of 2018. The Company will host a confrence call for the holders of its Series 1A, 2A, 1B and 2B Notes to discuss the First Quarter Reports. The conference call will take place on at 3:00 p.m. Israel time (2:00pm CET)
column48: Madison Pacific Properties Inc. announces the results of operations for the six months ended . The Company currently owns approximately $493 million in investment properties, comprised of 49 properties with approximately 1.7 million rentable sq. ft. of industrial and commercial space. Approximately 99% of the available space, excluding properties under development is currently leased. For a review of the risks and uncertainties to which the Company is subject see the annual MD&A.
column49: Nacho Fries are the traditional fast-food fry made with what the chain calls "Mexican seasoning," plus nacho cheese dipping sauce. The fries also come Supreme for $2.49 or Bell Grande for $3.49 with toppings, like beef, pico de gallo and sour cream. In August, Taco Bell rolled out the Naked Egg Taco, which uses a fried egg as the taco shell.
column50: Steve Wynn is the largest shareholder in the company, owning about 11.8 percent of the casino operator. His former wife has a 9.3 percent stake, according to Thomson Reuters Eikon data. The mogul resigned as CEO last month, following claims he subjected women who worked for him to unwanted advances. Steve Wynn has denied the accusations. The former CEO could not sell more than one-third of the shares he held.
column51: Antoine Andrews joined Nike in 2015, according to his LinkedIn profile. He was previously the global diversity and inclusion director at Symantec. His exit comes as the company is trying to change its workplace culture. Last month, Nike CEO Mark Parker sent a memo to employees regarding inappropriate workplace allegations and a subsequent shakeup in Nike's executive ranks. The memo said that Nike brand president Trevor Edwards would be resigning after 25 years with the company.
column52: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against Blue Buffalo Pet Products Inc. and its board of directors for breach of fiduciary duty. The proposed acquisition of the company by General Mills Inc. is valued at approximately $8 billion and is expected to close by May 2018. Stockholders will receive $40.00 for each share of Blue Buffalo that they hold. If you are a stockholder and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, please visit us at:
column53: Credit Agricole reported a 33 percent jump in quarterly profit as its investment banking unit held up well in a tough market environment. Fourth-quarter net income rose to 387 million euros ($479 million) from 291 million a year ago, when results were impacted by a goodwill impairment on its French retail operations. The bank also took a 384 million euros hit in the fourth quarter due to changes in taxation both in France and, to a lesser extent, in the United States.
column54: Citigroup said a " malicious actor" attempted to gain access to several Citi credit card accounts tied to the Department of Defense. Citi provides financial services for the Government Travel Charge Card, or GTCC, which is used by Defense personnel to pay for authorized expenses when on official travel. The Pentagon's Defense Management Travel Office oversees the processing of the GTCC. The Defense Department did not immediately respond to multiple requests for comment.
column55: Peter Navarro, one of President Donald Trump 's top trade advisors, recommended a man identified by some news outlets as an FBI informant for a top Trump administration job. Navarro floated Stefan Halper's name for unidentified ambassadorships in Asia, according to the news outlet. The headlines come at an inopportune time for Navarro. He already is embroiled in workplace controversy after clashing with Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin.
column56: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against Financial Engines, Inc. The proposed acquisition of the company by Hellman & Friedman is valued at approximately $3.02 billion. The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2018. If you are a stockholder of Financial engines, Inc and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, please visit us at:

If you are unable to participate during the live webcast, the call will be archived at . ParkOhio is a diversified international company.
column58: There is a "well-known" activist in United Technologies, CNBC's David Faber said. Faber added the fund does not have a "deep position" in the stock. United Technologies' chief executive said last week that the defense contractor is thinking of splitting up key parts of its business. The comments spurred a rally in the company's shares the following day. The company'sShares are up 2.9 percent Wednesday.
column59: Hub International Limited (Hub) announced today that it has acquired a property and casualty insurance book of business from Daniel Picard. Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed. Hub International Limited is a leading global insurance brokerage that provides property, casualty, life and health, employee benefits, investment and risk management products and services from offices located throughout North America. For more information, please visit hubinternational.com.
column60: Teradata Corp. will release its 2017 fourth quarter and full year financial results before the market opens on Thursday, . Teradata will host a conference call and live webcast at 8:30 a.m. ET the same day to discuss the results. The webcast and replay will be available on the Teradata website at investor.teradata.com/investor.
column61: Silvercrest Asset Management Group Inc. will host a teleconference at 8:30 am Eastern Time on , to discuss the company's financial results for the fourth quarter and year ended . Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President Richard R. Hough III and Chief Financial Officer Scott A. Gerard will review the quarterly results during the call. Immediately after the prepared remarks, there will be a question and answer session for analysts and institutional investors.
column62: Third-ranking official at the White House will step down after just nine months. The move follows President Donald Trump's repeated attacks on the media for their coverage of the Russia investigation. The White House says the decision was made by the president himself, not by the vice president. The president has been criticized for his handling of the investigation into the Clinton campaign's use of a private email server.
column63: Lennar Corporation, founded in 1954, is one of the nation's largest builders of quality homes for all generations. The Company builds affordable, move-up and retirement homes primarily under the Lennar brand name. Lennar's Financial Services segment provides mortgage financing, title insurance and closing services for both buyers of the Company's homes and others. The Rialto segment is a vertically integrated asset management platform focused on investing throughout the commercial real estate capital structure.
column64: Grubhub will host a conference call to discuss its first quarter financial results on Tuesday, , at 9:00 a.m. CT. CEO Matt Maloney and CFO Adam DeWitt will host the webcast. The live webcast of the conference call will be available on the investor relations section of the Grubhub website at .
column65: Resolute Energy Corporation (NYSE:REN) will issue a press release covering operating and financial results for the first quarter ended , after the market close on Monday, . An investor conference call to review first quarter results will be held on Tuesday, at 10:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time. The call can be accessed by calling (866) 548-4713 (US), (323) 794-2093 (
column66: Pfizer's consumer portfolio includes well-known brands such as Advil, Chapstick lip balm and Centrum vitamins. Pfizer said last year it was considering strategic alternatives, including a sale or spinoff. Despite her consumer products background, Emma Walmsley repeatedly said that the company's pharmaceuticals business and pharma research and development is GSK's top priority. "At this stage it would be weird if we didn't look at it," she said.
column67: Mark Zuckerberg will meet with the EU Parliament next week. He declined an invitation to testify before U.K. officials. EU officials have issued some of the strictest regulation on Silicon Valley in recent months. Facebook is facing probes from regulators around the world in the wake of reports that research firm Cambridge Analytica improperly gained access to the sensitive information of as many as 87 million Facebook users.
column68: Jack MacDonald to be head of global technology, media and telecom investment (TMT)banking. Anwar Zakkour, the banker who formerly led the TMT group, is leaving the bank. MacDonald will remain based in Palo Alto, California. He will work closely with the head of technology investment banking, Gary Kirkham, as well as Steve Baronoff and co-heads of global M&A, Patrick Ramsey and Adrian Mee.
column69: Longfin says its accounting firm has resigned from engaging with the company. The news comes one business day after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said it has frozen $27 million in proceeds from insider stock sales.Shares of tiny, little-known Longfin caught Wall Street's attention in mid-December when its stock surged more than 1,000 percent in two days after the company said it would acquire Ziddu.com.
column70: Consumer activist Amanda Werner dressed as a "Russian troll" at a Senate hearing. Werner is attending the hearing to draw attention to Facebook's failure to stop the misuse of its site. Zuckerberg is on Capitol Hill to answer questions about the data leak affecting 67 million Facebook users. Werner also dressed as the Monopoly man and sat behind former Equifax CEO Richard Smith during his Senate hearing last year.
column71: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted a link to the March For Our Lives page. Apple's Tim Cook and Microsoft's Satya Nadella sent out messages of support. The attack at the Google-owned video service's headquarters in San Bruno, California Tuesday was allegedly carried out by Nasim Najafi Aghdam , who killed herself after the shooting, according to law enforcement officials. At least three people were injured and the suspect shooter dead.
column72: The company will discuss first quarter results for the period ended . To hear the conference call live, please dial 1-517-308-9482 (domestic and international) and reference the passcode (EQIX) A replay of the call will be available one hour after the call through Wednesday, , by dialing 402-220-4189.
column73: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing said Thursday that its revenue forecast range for the second quarter is $7.8 billion. Morgan Stanley said Apple's iPhone was a big reason for TSMC's poor guidance. Skyworks Solutions, Qualcomm, Cirrus Logic, Qorvo and Analog Devices shares all declined more than 3 percent Thursday. Apple did not immediately respond to a request for comment..
column74: UGI Corporation will announce the results of its second fiscal quarter after the market closes on May 2. The company will hold a live internet audio webcast of its conference call to discuss results and other current activities at 9:00 AM EDT on Thursday, May 3. A telephonic replay will be available from 12:00 PM EDT on May 3 through 11:59 PM EDT May 10.
column75: CNBC's "Fast Money" traders share their first moves for the market open. Tim Seymour was a buyer of Citigroup. Karen Finerman bought Anthem. Steve Grasso bought General Electric. Guy Adami was a buyers of HCA Healthcare. The stocks and commodities mentioned or intended to be mentioned on CNBC's " fast money" were owned by the "Fast money" traders. The traders are short IWM, RACE, SPY.
column76: Dell's board is meeting later this month and will discuss its options. Dell bought data storage company EMC Corp for $67 billion in 2015. The maker of cloud-based virtualization software VMWare was majority-owned by EMC at the time of the deal and the ownership was transferred to Dell.VMware shares, which have gained over 62 percent in the past 12 months, touched an all-time high.
column77: Gulf Financial House (GFH) announced it would be selling its stake in the Abu Dhabi-based bank. The company has been in talks to sell the bank's stake in a joint venture with Abu Dhabi National Bank (ADN) The two banks have been working together for more than a decade. The deal is expected to be completed by the end of the year, according to the ADN.
column78: Iconix Brand Group, Inc. plans to report its first 2018 financial results before the market opens on Friday, . A conference call to discuss the financial results will be held at 10:00 AM ET that same day. The call can be accessed on the Company's website at . A written transcript will be posted online as soon as available.

column80: CIT declares a quarterly cash dividend of $0.16 per common share on its outstanding common stock. The common stock dividend is payable on to common shareholders of record as of . The CIT Board also declared the semi-annual dividend on the Series A preferred stock of $29.00 per share. CIT provides financing, leasing and advisory services principally to middle-market companies and small businesses across a wide variety of industries.
column81: Mr. Pertsovsky joined LetterOne Technology in London on 1 January 2018 from Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He served as the Country Executive for Russia & CIS since February 2013. Prior to that, he was at Renaissance Capital, which he joined in 2002 and oversaw the institutional securities business and Group activities in Russia. He holds an MS degree in Applied Mathematics from the Moscow Institute of Radio, Engineering and Automation.
column82: The 2.7-mile L.A. tunnel would be first to be completed of four such projects. It's billed as a "proof-of-process" tunnel in the company's large-scale plans for reducing transportation congestion and travel times. The company is also working on projects along the East Coast and in Chicago. The tunnels will eventually be a paid alternative to buses or subways.
column83: Teradyne, Inc. will release financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2017 on Wednesday, January 24 at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) or later. A conference call will follow at 10:00 a. m. ET, Thursday, January 25. Interested investors should access the webcast at
column84: Fannie Mae (OTC Bulletin Board: FNMA) today reported its first quarter 2018 results. The filing provides condensed consolidated financial statements for the quarter ended . Fannie Mae helps make the 30-year fixed-rate mortgage and affordable rental housing possible for millions of Americans. We are driving positive changes in housing finance to make the home buying process easier, while reducing costs and risk.
column85: The Milford Proving Ground in Michigan was the first proving ground in the U.S. and the world. Jay is introduced to the nearly $120,000 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1. He's about to become the first person to ever take it over 200 mph on "Jay Leno's Garage"Watch Jay take this Vette where it's never been before on an all-new " Jay Lenoâ€™s Garage " Thursday, May 3.
column86: Trump is expected to outline his administration 's long-awaited plan to lower prescription drug prices in a speech Friday. The plan, dubbed "American Patients First," will increase competition in the drug market and create incentives for manufacturers to lower list prices. The White House is planning to also publish a blueprint of its proposals. Trump has repeatedly chastised drugmakers for their prices, saying they are "getting away with murder"
column87: Peloton sells $2,000 spinning bikes that are equipped with a screen to stream recorded and live classes that are filmed from its New York-based studio. The company is more than doubling the size of the company every year, CEO John Foley told CNBC. Peloton was ranked No. 20 on CNBC's 2018 Disruptor 50 list. Competitor SoulCycle filed for an IPO in 2015.
column88: Nestle is reportedly close to deal with Starbucks on its grocery business. The deal is for the part of the Seattle-based company's coffee beans and drinks in supermarkets. An agreement will probably be announced on Monday, according to Bloomberg, who cited a person familiar with the situation. The news was first reported by Swiss financial blog Inside Paradeplatz. It added that the deal does not involve any of Starbucks' stores.
column89: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against CommerceHub, Inc. and its board of directors for breach of fiduciary duty. The proposed acquisition of the company by GTCR and Sycamore Partners is valued at approximately $1.1 billion. Shareholders will receive $22.75 in cash for each share of CommerceHub Inc. stock that they hold. The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2018.
column90: The new Italian government will be sworn in on Friday. The new government will include the far-right League and the center-left Democratic Party. The coalition will be made up of the League and Democratic Party, and the Democratic Party and the League's candidate for mayor of Rome, Giorgio Armani. The party's leader, Matteo Salvini, will be the new prime minister, replacing Silvio Berlusconi.
column91: The quarterly cash dividend of $0.57 per common share is payable on , to stockholders of record at the close of business on . Qualcomm's technologies powered the smartphone revolution and connected billions of people. We pioneered 3G and 4G - and now we are leading the way to 5G and a new era of intelligent, connected devices. For more information, visit
column92: Loprest specializes in water filtration, and treatment processes for the removal of iron and manganese, arsenic, nitrate and other contaminants. With hundreds of installations throughout California and the world, Loprest has provided reliable, durable, and cost-effective water treatment solutions for over ninety years. Water Remediation Technology LLC, based in Arvada, Colorado, is a premier water treatment company.
column93: The Hanover Insurance Group, Inc. expects to issue its fourth quarter financial results after the market closes on Wednesday, January 31. The company will webcast a discussion of its results on Thursday, February 1, at 10:00 a.m. ET. Those who would like to listen should go to the website 15 minutes prior to the start of the call to register, download and install any necessary audio software.
column94: Maxim Integrated Products Inc. (MXIM) reported a fiscal second-quarter loss of $75 million. On a per-share basis, the San Jose, California-based company said it had a loss of 27 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 65 cents per share.The chipmaker posted revenue of $622.6 million in the period.
column95: "I want them to come in from everywhere," Trump told reporters. Trump denies calling some developing nations "shithole countries" U.S. Democratic Senator Dick Durbin said last week that Trump had repeatedly use the word "s---hole" when speaking about African countries and the Caribbean nation of Haiti. Trump has denied using that language and said he wants immigrants from 'everywhere'
column96: Williams-Sonoma stock was up more than 15 percent in premarket trading. The retailer reported first-quarter earnings and revenue that easily beat analysts' expectations. Same-store sales were up 5.5 percent for the quarter, while merchandise inventories at the end of the quarter increased 1.5%. The retailer also gave strong revenue guidance for the second quarter, saying it now expects revenue of $1.25 billion.
column97: Bruce Steinberg was a senior investor at the $160 billion hedge fund. Steinberg, his wife, three children, and seven others were killed when the small charter plane they were aboard crashed in a mountainous area of Costa Rica. Another American family that died in the crash was from Florida. The crash also killed the American guide and the Costa Rican pilot and co-pilot, according to multiple news reports.
column98: Electronic Arts Inc. (EA) on Tuesday reported a loss of $186 million in its fiscal third quarter. The video game maker posted revenue of $1.16 billion in the period. For the current quarter ending in March, Electronic Arts said it expects revenue in the range of $ 1.53 billion. The company expects full-year earnings to be $3.25 per share.
column99: Alexandria Real Estate Equities Inc. (ARE) says it had funds from operations of $162.5 million. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The life science real estate company posted revenue of $320.1 million in the period. The company's shares have declined almost 5 percent since the beginning of the year.. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $124.34, a climb of 11 percent in the last year.
column100: Hologic plans to release its financial results for the first quarter of fiscal 2018 on Thursday, , after the market closes. In conjunction with the release, management will host a conference call that day at 4:30 p.m. Eastern Time. Interested participants may listen to the call by dialing 800-281-7973 (in the United States) or +1 323-794-2093 (for international callers) A replay will be available approximately
